clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of cancer and bone marrow transplant

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Sargramostim is used in the treatment of bone marrow transplant recipients or those exposed to chemotherapy an recovering from acut myelogenous leukemia Leukine or GM CSF is a hematopoietic growth factor which stimulates the survival clonal expansion proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic progenitor cells GM CSF is also capable of activating mature granulocytes and macrophages After a bone marrow transplant or chemotherapy patients have a reduced capacity to produce red and white blood cells Supplementing them with external sources of GM CSF helps bring the level of neutrophils back to normal so that they can better fight infections

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Bleomycin
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Cyclophosphamide is combined with Sargramostim
The risk or severity of peripheral neuropathy can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Vindesine
The risk or severity of peripheral neuropathy can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Vinorelbine
The risk or severity of peripheral neuropathy can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Vincristine
The risk or severity of peripheral neuropathy can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Vinblastine
The risk or severity of peripheral neuropathy can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Vintafolide
The risk or severity of peripheral neuropathy can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Vinflunine
The risk or severity of peripheral neuropathy can be increased when Sargramostim is combined with Vincamine
